comments:

I just tried it on I200409011200 and it is still happening.
I also tried it on Eclipse 3.0 and it is occuring as well.

Eclipse requires a 1.4 runtime. Does the problem occurr when using a 1.4 
runtime? What are the steps to reproduce?

Good point. It didn't occur to me that it could be JDK 5.0. It was running fine 
with Beta 2. To recreate I belive that if you move the mouse over the "Debug" 
view during debuging and if you click on the "Step into", "Step Over" etc... 
with the mouse then you will get the said error.
With JDK 1.4.2_05 it doesn't occur. Although I do hope that somebody tries and 
fixes this bug because there is a significant performance difference between 
1.4.2 and 5.0.

This bug just happened to me while doing a search (Ctrl+Shift+G). I think this
is an SWT issue to do with Trees rather than debug. Can you please reassign it
to the SWT team?
Any Chance this could be looked it. It is happening both with JDK 1.5 and JDK 1.6.
please look at comment 13 in Bug 75796 for a clue as to why this might be happening.
